snippet: State and local governments are spending on projects that were stalled — like an effort in Naples, Fla., to prevent pelicans from entangling fishing lines — and even some federal spending is rising.
abstract: Local and state governments nationwide, for first time since 2011, are spending on suspended projects, increasing prosperity; federal spending is also rising in some sectors; Naples, Fla, spent money to help pelicans trapped in fishing lines, in symbol of rising affluence; political pressure to cut spending has eased as federal deficit has dropped sharply; some economists say infrastructure spending and other capital investments will spur economy.
lead_paragraph: State and local governments are spending on projects that were stalled — like an effort in Naples, Fla., to prevent pelicans from entangling fishing lines — and even some federal spending is rising.

headline.main: Government Spending, Edging Up, Is a Stimulus
headline.print_headline: Government Spending, Edging Up, Is a Stimulus
